heading: Objective
body: Turn delivery into long-term loyalty by executing a consistent post-sale follow-up system that protects trust, builds confidence in ownership, and creates repeat/referral momentum—without sounding scripted or pushy.

heading: Why this matters
body: Customers leave when they feel forgotten. Post-sale follow-up prevents regret, builds trust, and increases service retention, reviews, and referrals.

heading: LOYALTY LOOP
body: Confirm ownership success → reduce friction → build memory → introduce service → earn the ask.

heading: First 7–10 days
body: Early ownership experiences shape emotional memory and loyalty.

heading: Helpfulness beats discounts
body: Support and reliability create stronger loyalty than price memories.

heading: Consistency signals professionalism
body: A predictable cadence makes customers feel remembered, not hunted.

heading: Reciprocity earns the ask
body: When you help first, customers are more open to reviews and referrals.

heading: Service familiarity drives retention
body: Service retention rises when customers understand what to expect and feel welcomed.

heading: Cadence minimum
body: Follow-up at 24–48 hours, 7 days, 30 days, 90 days, plus service milestone touches.

heading: Purposeful touches
body: Every follow-up must be helpful; avoid empty ‘just checking in.’

heading: Personalization
body: Use notes to reference something real about them and their life.

heading: One ask per touch
body: Never stack review + referral + service asks; choose one based on value delivered.

heading: Own and solve issues
body: Acknowledge, take next step, promise update time, and follow through.

heading: 48-hour help script
body: Ask ‘love + friction’ and offer help with setup or questions.

heading: 30-day service intro
body: Ask permission to schedule and explain what to expect for the first visit.

heading: Review ask
body: Short, earned, no-pressure request after value is delivered.

heading: Referral ask
body: Natural, respectful line connecting back to trust and care.

heading: Role-play focus
body: Practice 48-hour call, service intro, problem ownership, review ask, and referral ask.

heading: Worksheet purpose
body: Plan cadence dates, personalization notes, service intro, and one-ask follow-up lines.
